Instrument.name: LINEAR ETALON IMAGING SPECTRAL ARRAY
Instrument.description: The Ralph experiment consists of two channels, the Multispectral Visible Imaging Camera (Ralph MVIC) and the Linear Etalon Imaging Spectral Array (Ralph LEISA). The main objectives are to obtain high-resolution color maps and surface composition maps of Pluto and Charon, including global dayside four-color maps at 0.7 km/pixel resolution, dayside hyper-spectral near-infrared maps at 7 km/pixel globally and 0.6 km/pixel for selected areas, and maps of dayside surface ice distribution and temperatures.
